column99:
Do you want to be part of the green transition and ensure that Vestas' largest blades are produced in the best quality? Do you dream of collaborating with good, talented people, developing yourself professionally and learning new things? Then you might be our next Quality Technician at Nakskov Factory   
 Manufacturing and Global Procurement > COO NCE > Production Quality  The main scope of the Quality Department is both Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Control (QC) in terms of creating and supporting in creation of procedures, policy, instructions, standards, records.  In other words, responsible for delivering a product meeting the specifications. Within the scope of the Quality Department, it is also the compliance of the Quality Management System (QMS) to the International Standards and resolution of customer concerns. In cooperation with the Quality Department and the support functions you must ensure that the quality controls are conducted according to the control plan, that non-conformities are identified and that appropriate corrective measures are taken, while keeping a secure and safe work environment. As Quality Technician, you will be responsible for a specific department (but support in others should also be expected). 
 We are looking for candidates for both day and night shift 12 hour shifts.  
 Responsibilities :  
 
 Update status on Daily Management Boards and communicate it to production 
 Operate as part of the Production Team, supporting Group Leads and Production Workers to achieve the right quality 
 Print out shop floor documentation and keep it updated (MCP, PII, PWI, QDA, TP, 1P) 
 Make sure quality data are collected (QDA, defect mapping) and  that quality tools are available and good to use on the shopfloor 
 Thermography and Ultrasound scanning and evaluation 
 Implement and follow green tagging procedure 
 Material testing (DSC, FVF) 
 
 Qualifications 
 
 You are reliable and thrive with changes, in a rapid moving organization 
 You are quality oriented and you are structured in your work 
 You work with ease across different cultures 
 Able to use Microsoft Office 
 SAP experience is desirable 
 Highschool, technical education or similar is required (if no education, 3,5 year minimum of working experience in Vestas) 
 A vision test and a color blindness test is a prerequisite 
 
 Competencies : 
 
 Good communication skills in English preferably also Danish 
 You are quality focused and structured in your work 
 You enjoy working with many different people with different cultural backgrounds 
 
 What we offer Join us for an exciting journey in an environment supporting personal and professional growth within the global renewable energy industry. At Vestas, we value initiative, responsibility, and a balance between creativity and quality. Experience firsthand our core values: Passion, Accountability, Simplicity, and Collaboration, shaping our work culture and initiatives.   
 Additional information Work location: Nakskov, DK Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis however, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before 04th July 2024
